classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: You have learned to mold and reshape the magic that curses you into spells.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You know two cantrips of your choice from the Witch spell list. {@spell Chill Touch|XPHB} and {@spell Minor Illusion|XPHB} are recommended. You can choose Hexes when you pick Witch cantrips.
Whenever you gain a Witch level, you can replace one of your cantrips with another cantrip of your choice from the Witch spell list.
When you reach Witch levels 4 and 10, you learn another cantrip of your choice from the Witch spell list, as shown in the Cantrips column of the Witch Features table

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Witch Features table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your level 1+ spells. You regain all expended slots when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+
entries: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose two level 1 spells from the Witch spell list. {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laguhter|XPHB|Hideous Laughter} and {@spell Thunderwave|XPHB} are recommended.

The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Witch levels, as shown in the Prepared Spells column of the Witch Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional spells from the Witch spell list until the number of spells on your list matches the number on the table. The chosen spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

If another Witch feature gives you spells that you always have prepared, those spells don't count against the number of spells you can prepare with this feature, but those spells otherwise count as Witch spells for you.

entries.name: Changing Your Prepared Spells
entries: Whenever you gain a Witch level, you can replace one spell on your list with another Witch spell for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your Witch spells.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an Arcane Focus as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Witch spells.

classFeature.name: Witch's Curse
entries: You're adept at drawing and firing before others have time to react, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Initiative
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} rolls.

entries.name: Double Draw
entries: You can draw or stow two weapons that lack {@itemProperty 2H|XPHB|Two-Handed} when you would normally be able to draw or stow only one.

classFeature.name: Hexes
entries: You learn a number of powerful cantrips, known as Hexes, derived from the same insidious magic that cursed you.

You know two Hexes of your choice from the Witch spell list, which don't count against your number of cantrips known. {@spell Hex: Misfortune|ValdaSpire24} and {@spell Hex: Ruin|ValdaSpire24} are recommended. Whenever you gain a Witch level, you can replace one of your Hexes with another Hex of your choice from the Witch spell list. When you gain certain Witch levels, you gain more Hexes of your choice, as shown in the Hexes column of the Witch Features table.

classFeature.name: Cackle
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to Cackle. When you do so, you extend the duration of one of your Hexes by 1 round, provided the target of the Hex is within the spell's range.

Not all Witches laugh maniacally when they Cackle, but all Cackles require a Verbal component, as if casting a spell. These range from mundane curses and insults, to the murmuring of dead languages and speaking backwards.

classFeature.name: Familiar
entries: You always have the {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB} spell prepared, and you can cast it in 10 minutes without a spell slot or components. The spell is improved in the following ways when you cast it.

entries.name: Expanded Options
entries: You can choose one of the normal forms for your familiar or one of the following special forms: {@creature Death Snail|ValdaWitch}, {@creature Flying Book|ValdaWitch}, {@creature Homunculus|XMM}, {@creature Mock|ValdaWitch}, {@creature Moon Jelly|ValdaWitch}, {@creature Pet Rock|ValdaWitch}, {@creature Pseudodragon|XMM} (can't use its Sting), {@creature Rag Doll|ValdaWitch}, {@creature Tin Soldier|ValdaWitch}, and {@creature Winter Wolf Pup|ValdaWitch}. The statistics for creatures marked with an asterisk can be found in the Familiars section later in the class description.

entries.name: Witch Familiar
entries: The familiar's stat block is improved, as detailed in the Witch Familiar sidebar.

entries.name: Synchronized Turns
entries: Your familiar takes its turn immediately before or after your turn each round (your choice).

entries.name: Quick Attack
entries: Once per turn as an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can command your familiar to take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action (one attack only) on its turn.

entries.name: Spell Channeling
entries: When you cast a spell with a range other than Self on your turn, you can cast it as if you were in your familiar's space. The familiar must be within 100 feet of you, and it must take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to deliver the spell when you cast the spell as normal.

classFeature.name: Witch Subclass
entries: You gain a Witch subclass of your choice. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Witch levels. For the rest of your career, you gain each of your subclass's features that are of your Witch level or lower.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Insidious Spell
entries: When a creature fails its saving throw against one of your Hexes, it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on saving throws it makes against your Witch spells before the end of your next turn. Similarly, if it fails its saving throw against one of your Witch spells, it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on saving throws it makes against your Hexes until the end of your next turn.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Witch Subclass.

classFeature.name: Improved Familiar
entries: Your {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB} spell improves in the following ways.

entries.name: Force Damage
entries: Whenever your familiar deals damage with an attack, it can deal your choice of Force or its normal damage type.

entries.name: Expanded Options
entries: You can choose one of the following forms for your familiar: {@creature Fright|ValdaWitch}, {@creature Grep|ValdaWitch}, {@creature Imp|XMM}, {@creature Quasit|XMM}, {@creature Sprite|XMM}, or {@creature Yarn Golem|ValdaWitch}. The statistics for creatures marked with an asterisk can be found in the Familiars section later in the class description.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Hastened Hex
entries: Once per turn when you cast a Hex as a Magic action, you can cast a Witch cantrip that isn't a Hex and has a casting time of an action as a part of that casting.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Witch Subclass.

classFeature.name: Grand Hex
entries: You have perfected deeply malevolent forms of magic. You gain one Grand Hex of your choice. Whenever you gain a Witch level, you can replace one of your Grand Hexes with another one. Grand Hexes are described in the “Grand Hex Options” section later on in the class's description.
