classFeature.name: Vengeful Curse
entries: When an enemy you can see within 60 feet of yourself deals damage that causes you or an ally you can see within 60 feet of yourself to become {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to curse the enemy. Until the end of your next turn, the cursed creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests}.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@filter Epic Boon feat|feats|category=EB} or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Hexmaster
entries: You have mastered your foul magic. When you cast a Hex that requires a saving throw, you can cause one target to automatically fail.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore one use of it by expending a spell slot (no action required).

action.name: Leech
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) Necrotic damage and the snail regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the Necrotic damage dealt.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) Bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The fright can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) Necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum decreases by an amount equal to the damage taken.

trait.name: Mimicry
entries: The grep can mimic simple sounds it has heard, such as a whisper or chitter. A hearer can discern the sounds are imitations with a successful {@dc 10} Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) check.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 6}, reach 5 ft. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) Slashing damage.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The jelly can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The jelly sheds {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} in a 10-foot radius.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 3}, reach 5 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) Poison damage.

trait.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
entries: The mock adheres to anything that touches it. The mock has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against any creature adhered to it. The target or a creature within 5 feet of it can detach the mock as an action.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 3}, reach 5 ft. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) Piercing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) Acid damage.

bonus.name: Shape-Shift
entries: The mock shape-shifts to resemble a Tiny object while retaining its game statistics, or it returns to its true blob form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

trait.name: Just a Rock
entries: The rock counts as an object. Additionally, it can't take actions and its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} can't be increased.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 3}, reach 5 ft. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) Bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The pup has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the pup's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 3}, reach 5 ft. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) Piercing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) Cold damage.

action.name: Bayonet
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Rifle {@recharge}
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 12}, one creature that the tin soldier can see within 30 feet. {@actSaveFail} 7 ({@damage 2d6}) Piercing damage.

monster.name: Yarn Golem
languages: understands Common plus one other language but can't speak

action.name: Poke
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Tangle {@recharge}
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 12}, one creature that the golem can see within 5 feet. {@actSaveFail} If the target is Medium or smaller, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 12}). While {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, the target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition.

spell.name: Arcane Anomaly
entries: You create a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you that distorts magical energy. For the duration, whenever a spell is cast within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 5 or 6, the spell dissipates with no effect, and the action, {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, or {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} used to cast it is wasted. If that spell was cast with a spell slot, the slot isn't expended.

spell.name: Accursed Act
entries: Lighting a candle, you attempt to curse a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be cursed for the duration. Until the spell ends, the creature takes Psychic damage equal to {@dice 1d8} plus your spellcasting ability modifier whenever it makes an attack roll or casts a spell. The target only takes this damage once per turn. The spell ends early if the target doesn't attack or cast a spell on its turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Candy Blast
entries: You summon a handful of hard candy—boiled sweets, mints, jelly beans, etc.—and hurl them at a creature you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} Force damage and the candy forms a pile on the ground in its space, causing a 5-foot-square area of your choice in the target's space to become {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. The candy produced by this pell is edible, but has no nutritional value, and vanishes after 1 minute, ending any {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d8}), 11 ({@dice 3d8}), and 17 ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Corruption Curse
entries: With a piercing glare and a sinister gesture, you send ribbons of dark magic toward a creature you can see within range. For the duration, the target is cursed and suffers one of the following effects of your choice.

entries.name: Dull Reflexes
entries: The target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Dexterity checks and saving throws.

entries.name: Feeble Fortitude
entries: The target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Constitution saving throws and can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Weak Will
entries: The target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Wisdom saving throws and spell attack rolls.

spell.name: Curse of Aging
entries: A creature you touch must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be cursed to age and wither. While cursed, the target ages at ten times the normal rate, becoming ten days older for each day that passes. Additionally, the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Strength checks and saving throws.

spell.name: Curse of Binding

components.m: a body part from the intended target, such as a fingernail, a lock of hair, or a drop of blood

entries: You attempt to bind a creature or object to a location. Choose a target and a point within range that you can see. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be cursed to remain within 30 feet of the point. If the target starts its turn further than 30 feet from the point, it must succeed on a Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check against your spell save DC or be dragged 60 feet toward the point. Additionally, if the creature tries to use teleportation or interplanar travel, it must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failure, the attempt fails and wastes the spell or effect. On a success, the spell ends.

spell.name: Curse of Blades
entries: You attempt to drive a creature you can see within range to violence. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be cursed and have the Frenzied condition for the duration.

A creature with the Frenzied condition loses the ability to distinguish between friend and foe, regarding all creatures it can see as enemies. While Frenzied, the creature chooses the targets for its attacks, spells, and abilities randomly from among the creatures it can see within range, and it must make an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} if any creature provokes one.
At the end of its turn, an affected creature can repeat its saving throw, ending the spell early on a success.

spell.name: Curse of Chains
entries: A black brand resembling iron shackles appears on a creature you can see within range, which must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be cursed for the duration. While cursed, the target's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0 and can't increase. The target can take an action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, the spell ends.

spell.name: Curse Ward
entries: You reach out your hand and touch a willing creature, raising a smoke-like barrier around it. For the duration, the target has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage and can't be cursed or possessed. If the target is already under one of these effects, the effect is suppressed until the spell ends.

spell.name: Curse Object

m.text: powdered onyx worth 100+ GP, which the spell consumes

entries: You bestow a curse upon an object that you touch. The object must be one that isn't being worn or carried and is able to fit within a 5-foot cube. Until the spell ends, the object becomes magical (requiring attunement) and cursed. The fact that the object is cursed is revealed only when an Identify spell is cast on it or a creature attunes to it. When a creature attunes to the object, the curse extends to it for the duration. Choose the curse from the following effects.

entries.name: Bleeding
entries: The attuned creature can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Frenzied (Weapon Only)
entries: Whenever the attuned creature deals damage with the cursed weapon, it has the Frenzied condition for 1 minute. A creature with the Frenzied condition loses the ability to distinguish between friend and foe, regarding all creatures it can see as enemies. While Frenzied, the creature chooses the targets for its attacks, spells, and abilities randomly from among the creatures it can see within range, and it must make an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} if any creature provokes one.

entries.name: Hobbled
entries: The attuned creature's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is halved and can't take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action.

entries.name: Obsessed
entries: The attuned creature is unwilling to part with the object, keeping it on its person at all times. If the cursed object is a weapon, the attuned creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls with weapons other than the cursed weapon.

entries.name: Restless
entries: Whenever the attuned creature finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or gain no benefits from the rest.

entries.name: Speechless
entries: The attuned creature can't speak.

entries.name: Unfortunate
entries: Whenever the target rolls a 20 on the {@dice d20} of a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, the roll instead becomes a 1.

entries.name: Vulnerable
entries: The attuned creature has {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to one damage type (choose when you cast this spell).

spell.name: Demand

components.m: a snake's tongue and a piece of copper wire

entries: This spell projects a select Enchantment spell to a target, regardless of distance. When you cast {@spell Charm Monster|XPHB}, {@spell Charm Person|XPHB}, {@spell Command|XPHB}, {@spell Dominate Beast|XPHB}, {@spell Dominate Person|XPHB}, {@spell Geas|XPHB}, or {@spell Suggestion|XPHB}, before this spell ends, you modify its casting so that its range becomes unlimited. This spell then ends.

Choose a target with which you are familiar (whether or not you can see it) for the Enchantment spell. If the spell requires a verbal command, the creature hears the command in its mind and recognizes you as the sender if it knows you.

You can project the spell across any distance, and even to other planes of existence, but if the target is on a different plane than you, there is a {@chance 5} chance that the Enchantment spell fails and has no effect.

spell.name: Eldritch Orb
entries: You fling a ball of eldritch energy at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} Force damage and explodes in a 5-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}. Each creature in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking half the amount of Force damage on a failed save, or none on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d8}), 11 ({@dice 3d8}), and 17 ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Elemental Curse
entries: A spark leaps from your finger to a creature you touch, spreading in bright cracks across its skin. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be cursed for the duration. The cursed target has {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to your choice of Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder damage. If the creature has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to the chosen damage type, it instead loses that {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB}. If the target has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the chosen damage type, it instead has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to that damage type.

spell.name: Exhume
entries: Choose an unoccupied 20-foot square on the ground within range. This spell causes one pile of Humanoid bones to rise out of the ground within that square. If you cast this spell within a burial place such as a graveyard, mausoleum, or barrow, {@dice 1d4} corpses or piles of bones are exhumed. The ground itself isn't disturbed by this spell; the bones simply appear out of the ground.

spell.name: Face Swap
entries: You place an {@condition invisible} sigil on a willing target you can see within range. This sigil lasts until the spell ends.

For the duration, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to project your face onto the marked creature until you dismiss the effect (no action required). When you do so, you can see, hear, and speak through the marked creature as if you occupied its space. You use your senses instead of those of the marked creature.

spell.name: Flawed Reconstruction
entries: You stitch together the wounds of a creature you touch, which regains {@dice 3d6} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. However, the mending is imperfect, and the target's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum is reduced by {@dice 1d6}, to a minimum of 1.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The healing increases by {@dice 2d6} and the reduction increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Frenzy
entries: With a gesture, you reduce a crowd to base instinct and violence. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on a point you choose within range makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature has the Frenzied condition for the duration.

A creature with the Frenzied condition loses the ability to distinguish between friend and foe, regarding all creatures it can see as enemies. While Frenzied, the creature chooses the targets for its attacks, spells, and abilities randomly from among the creatures it can see within range, and it must make an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} if any creature provokes one.
The Frenzied condition ends after 1 minute, or when the spell ends. At the end of its turn, an affected creature can repeat its saving throw, ending the condition on itself early on a success.

spell.name: Gahoul's Scapegoat
entries: You trace a complex arcane symbol on the flesh of a willing creature you touch, marking it for sacrifice. When you are hit by an attack roll during the spell's duration and the marked creature is within 60 feet of yourself, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to teleport, swapping places with the creature and forcing it to be hit by the attack instead of you. The spell then ends

spell.name: Hex: Abate
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target can't make Opportunity Attacks until the spell ends at the end of your next turn.

spell.name: Hex: Apathy
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@variantrule Indifferent [Attitude]|XPHB|Indifferent} about creatures of your choice that it is {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} toward. This indifference ends if the target takes damage or is forced to make a saving throw. When the spell ends at the end of your next turn, the creature's attitude returns to normal.

spell.name: Hex: Bleeding
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, each time the target takes damage until the spell ends at the end of your next turn, it takes an extra {@damage 1d4} Necrotic damage. If the target is {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, it takes an extra {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage instead.

spell.name: Hex: Charm
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Wisdom saving throw. It does so with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} if you or your allies are fighting it. On a failed save, the target has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition until the spell ends at the end of your next turn. The spell ends early if you or your allies deal damage to the target. When the spell ends, the target knows it was {@condition Charmed|XPHB} by you.

spell.name: Hex: Disorient
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target must subtract {@dice 1d4} from attack rolls it makes until the spell ends at the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The die subtracted from attack rolls changes when you reach level 5 ({@dice 1d6}), 11 ({@dice 1d8}), and 17 ({@dice 1d10}).

spell.name: Hex: Doomward
entries: You touch a willing creature. The first time the target would drop to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} before the spell ends at the end of your next turn, the target instead drops to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}, and the spell ends. This spell has no effect if you have cast this spell on the target within the past 24 hours.

spell.name: Hex: Duplicity
entries: You create an illusory duplicate of yourself in your space. When a creature hits you with an attack before the spell ends at the end of your next turn, roll a {@dice d6}. On 4 or higher, the attack strikes the duplicate instead of you and the spell ends. The duplicate otherwise ignore all other damage and effects. A creature is unaffected by this spell if it has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition, {@sense Blindsight|XPHB}, or {@sense Truesight|XPHB}.

spell.name: Hex: Evil Eye
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the spell ends at the end of your next turn.

spell.name: Hex: Fortune
entries: You touch a willing creature. Until the spell ends at the end of your next turn, the target has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws.

spell.name: Hex: Garble
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature can't speak coherently or cast spells with a Verbal component until the spell ends at the end of your next turn.

spell.name: Hex: Go Unseen
entries: Repeating an ancient chant, you have the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition until the spell ends at the end of your next turn. Creatures within 10 feet of yourself that can hear can detect your location for the spell's duration. The spell ends early if you make an attack roll, deal damage, or cast a spell.

spell.name: Hex: Hobble
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is reduced to 10 feet until the spell ends at the end of your next turn. If the target is flying, it falls, unless it has the ability to hover.

spell.name: Hex: Mire
entries: You transform the ground in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you into murky swamp, which is {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} until the spell ends at the end of your next turn. This {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} doesn't cost you extra movement.

spell.name: Hex: Misfortune
entries: Choose one creature you can see within range. Until the spell ends at the end of your next turn, whenever the target rolls a 20 on the {@dice d20} of a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, the roll instead becomes a 1.

spell.name: Hex: Obfuscate
entries: You produce fog in a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you. The fog spreads around corners, and its area is {@variantrule Heavily Obscured|XPHB}. This fog lasts until the spell ends at the end of your next turn or until a strong wind (such as one created by Gust of Wind) disperses it, ending the spell.

spell.name: Hex: Peacebond
entries: You create a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you that locks weapons to their containers. The weapons and ammunition of each creature within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} become fixed in their sheaths, quivers, or holsters until the spell ends at the end of your next turn. A creature can take a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check against your spell save DC, freeing an item from its container on a success.

spell.name: Hex: Pox
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the spell ends at the end of your next turn.

spell.name: Hex: Ruin
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target has a -2 penalty to AC until the spell ends at the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The penalty to AC increases by 1 when you reach levels 5 (-3), 11 (-4), and 17 (-5).

spell.name: Hex: Stupor
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition until the spell ends at the end of your next turn. The spell ends on a target if it takes damage or someone within 5 feet of it takes an action to shake it out of the spell's effect. Once the spell ends on a target, it is immune to this spell for the next 24 hours.

spell.name: Hex: Tremors
entries: A miniature earthquake shakes the ground in a 5-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you. Each creature on the ground in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. A creature that enters the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} or ends its turn there must also succeed on that save or fall {@condition Prone|XPHB}. This spell ends at the end of your next turn.

spell.name: Hex: Ward
entries: You touch a willing creature. Each time the target takes damage before the spell ends at the end of your next turn, the damage it takes is reduced by 2.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage reduction increases by 1 when you reach levels 5 (-3), 11 (-4) and 17 (-5).

spell.name: Hocuspocus
entries: You conjure minor paranormal phenomena and other ominous effects. Choose the effect from the options below. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its effects active at a time.

entries.name: Grave Mists
entries: A rolling fog gathers on the ground in a 15-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} for 1 minute.

entries.name: Ominous Lights
entries: You cause all candles, torches, and other open flames to darken and flicker for 1 minute.

entries.name: Paranormal Chill
entries: You can chill or warm the air in a 10-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} by 10 degrees for 1 minute.

entries.name: Poltergeist Activity
entries: You cause small, unattended objects to rattle or levitate an inch off the ground for 1 minute.

entries.name: Spirit Orbs
entries: You create up to four fist-sized spectral, glowing orbs, which float around within range for 1 minute. The orbs don't provide light, apart from a dim glow.

entries.name: Spooky Noises
entries: You create a quiet sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as ominous whispers, the drone of insects, or the sound of crying. The sound lasts for 1 minute.

spell.name: Hollowing Curse
entries: Tendrils of vitality-draining mist extend from your fingertips. A creature you can see within range makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 2d6} Necrotic damage and is cursed for the duration. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

On each of your subsequent turns, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to deal damage to the cursed creature. The damage equals {@damage 2d6} Necrotic damage if you took the {@action Magic|XPHB} action or half as much if you took a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 2d6} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Identity Curse
entries: You touch a creature's temple and attempt to erase its identity. One creature you touch makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target has the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition for 1 hour and is cursed to forget its identity. When the target awakens, it loses all its personal memories, though it retains its general knowledge, proficiencies, and other statistics. The target doesn't realize it has any class features, feats, or magical abilities, and so doesn't willingly use them unless it rediscovers them. If left to its own devices, the target will quickly adopt a new name and begin to build a new identity. When the spell ends, the target regains its past memories.

spell.name: Intrusive Thought

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of yourself making an attack roll

entries: You attempt to distort a creature's thinking. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or automatically miss with the triggering attack.

spell.name: Mandy's Enchanted Carriage
entries: You shape-shift a vegetable into a Large magical carriage, complete with reins and two quasi-real horses. The carriage is luxurious and carries up to six passengers—four within and two atop it at the coach's seat. Creatures within the carriage have {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover} from external effects, but can see outside through a pair of windows composed of magical force. While sitting in the coach's seat, a creature can control the carriage, which has a {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} of 100 feet and can travel 10 miles in an hour, or 13 miles at a fast pace.
The carriage and horses count as a single object with 12 AC and 100 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. The spell ends early if the carriage and horses are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Duration
entries: This spell's duration varies depending upon when and where it was cast. If cast in a location where time passes normally, the spell lasts until the twelfth stroke of the next midnight, however long that may be. Elsewhere, the spell lasts for 24 hours. When the spell ends, the carriage's occupants are ejected into adjacent unoccupied spaces, the carriage shrinks back into a vegetable, and the quasi-real horses vanish.

spell.name: Mandy's Feral Follower
entries: You touch a Small or smaller Beast. The Beast then transforms into a Humanoid with the statistics of a Commoner and an appearance of your choosing. The commoner is friendly to you and your allies, has a basic understanding of all simple unskilled tasks, and can understand the languages you speak, but doesn't speak. The commoner wears Fine Clothes, but has no other equipment.

entries.name: Combat
entries: The commoner is an ally to you and your allies. It rolls its own {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} and acts on its own turn. It behaves as though it is dutifully employed by you.

entries.name: Duration
entries: This spell's duration varies depending upon when and where it was cast. If cast in a location where time passes normally, the spell lasts until the twelfth stroke of the next midnight, however long that may be. Elsewhere, the spell lasts for 24 hours.

entries.name: Ending the Transformation
entries: The transformation lasts for the duration, or until the commoner drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or dies. When it reverts to its true form, the Beast returns to the number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} it had before it transformed and its clothes dissipate into smoke. If it reverts as a result of dropping to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, any excess damage carries over to its true form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce the Beast's normal form to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, it isn't knocked {@condition Unconscious|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can transform one additional Beast for each spell slot above 4.

spell.name: Mandy's Marvelous Dress
entries: A willing creature you touch is instantly clothed in a fabulous ball gown, perfectly tailored and complete with a set of glittering jewelry. You can choose for the dress to sit atop the creature's clothing or armor, or for it to magically replace its outfit. The creature can't remove the dress until the spell ends; similarly, the jewelry vanishes if it is removed.

entries.name: Elegant Flair
entries: Until the spell ends, when the wearer makes a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} using Charisma, it can replace the number it rolls with a 10.

entries.name: Glamorous Ward
entries: If the wearer of the dress is attacked by a creature that can see it, the attacker must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or miss with the attack. On a success, the attacker is immune to this effect until the spell ends.

entries.name: Duration
entries: This spell's duration varies depending upon when and where it was cast. If cast in a location where time passes normally, the spell lasts until the twelfth stroke of the next midnight, however long that may be. Elsewhere, the spell lasts for 24 hours. When the spell ends, the dress vanishes in a puff of sparkles, and the creature becomes clothed in its original outfit.

spell.name: Minor Lifesteal
entries: You attempt to drain life energy from a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage. You gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the amount of Necrotic damage dealt.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d6}), 11 ({@dice 3d6}), and 17 ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Pharaoh's Curse
entries: Opening your palm, you release a puff of dust containing the pestilence of mummy rot. One creature you choose within range must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be cursed for the duration. While cursed, the target can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum doesn't return to normal when finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, and its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum decreases by {@dice 3d6} every 24 hours that elapse. A creature dies and turns to dust if reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} by this curse.

spell.name: Prehensile Hair
entries: When you cast this spell, you can cause any of your body hair to grow up to 15 feet in length. Your hair becomes supernaturally tough and you can magically use it to extend your reach for the duration. Using your hair, you can cast spells with a range of Touch, take the Help or Utilize action, or perform simple tasks out to a range of 15 feet. Your hair can't wield weapons, Shields, or carry objects heavier than 10 pounds. Your hair returns to its normal length when this spell ends.

spell.name: Protect Threshold

components.m: an ounce of salt for each foot of the warded portal's perimeter

entries: Tracing arcane sigils along its boundary, you can ward a doorway, window, or other portal from entry. For the duration, an {@condition Invisible|XPHB} eldritch creature stalks the warded portal. Any creature that attempts to pass through the portal makes a Wisdom saving throw or takes {@damage 4d6} Psychic damage, or half as much on a successful save.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 2.

spell.name: Psychedelics
entries: For a moment, the colors in a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you shift in a rainbow swirl. Each creature you choose in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the next attack roll it makes against you until the spell ends at the end of your next turn. Additionally, the colors of objects you choose within range change randomly and remain brightly and unnaturally colored for 1 hour.

spell.name: Restore Youth

m.text: gold dust worth 500+ GP, which the spell consumes

entries: You perform a complex ritual for a creature you touch, reducing its apparent age by {@dice 2d10} years, to a minimum of 18 years. This spell doesn't extend the creature's lifespan.

spell.name: Ruby-Eye Curse
entries: A red haze clouds the eyes of a creature that meets your gaze. A creature you choose within range must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be cursed for the duration. While cursed, the target can see normally out to a range of 5 feet, but has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition beyond this range.

spell.name: Scurry
entries: A nonmagical object you choose within range sprouts legs and runs away. You can't target an object that weighs more than 10 pounds, nor can you target one that is being worn; however, you can target certain objects that are being carried, as long as they aren't affixed entirely around a creature's body or being held in a hand. For example, you can't target a creature's helmet or a sword it is wielding, but you can target a drawstring pouch it is wearing or a dagger that is sheathed at its side.

The object animates, wriggles free of its owner (if it has one), sprouts two legs, and moves 20 feet in a direction you choose. At the start of each of your turns, you can choose which direction the object moves. The object has an AC of 10, if its AC wasn't already higher. The spell ends early if the object is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or is picked up.

spell.name: Séance

m.text: a crystal ball, deck of tarot cards, or ouija board, and incense worth 50+ GP

entries: You and three or more willing creatures lock hands to conjure a spirit from the afterlife to answer your questions. Describe or name a creature that is familiar to you. If the creature's soul is free and willing, it manifests as a ghostly specter. This spell fails if the spirit was the target of this spell within the last 10 days.

Until the spell ends, you can ask up to three questions of the specter. The specter knows only what it knew in life, including the languages it knew. Answers are usually brief, cryptic, or repetitive, and the specter is under no compulsion to offer a truthful answer if you are hostile to it or it recognizes you as an enemy. There is a {@chance 5} chance that this spell contacts the wrong spirit, one which will answer questions untruthfully or ambiguously.

spell.name: Secret Enclave
entries: You conjure a shimmering, 10-foot wide multicolored portal within range that leads to a demiplane. When you cast the spell, you also enchant an object that can fit within an 5-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube}, which becomes the demiplane's portal key.

The demiplane is a 1,000-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} that resembles a magical forest of the Feywild. The floor is made of fertile soil that can't be burrowed through. The portal into the demiplane and the matching portal out of the demiplane opens only while the portal key is within 60 feet of the portal. Once the demiplane is created, the location of its portal is fixed and it can only be opened from that same location.
You or anyone else within 60 feet of the portal can open the portal by casting this spell again. You can also create a replacement portal key or a duplicate one by casting this spell again.
The portal key and any creature within the demiplane can't be targeted by any Divination spell, though a Wish spell can reveal the location of the portal key.
You can create Secret Enclaves within Secret Enclaves, but only if the original demiplane was created by you.

spell.name: Shriek
entries: You release a blood-curdling screech in a 5-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}. Each Large or smaller creature you choose within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} is pushed 5 feet away from you.

spell.name: Soul Effigy
entries: A Humanoid you touch makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a fragment of its soul is bound to the doll used in this spell's casting, which becomes an effigy of that creature. The spell ends if the effigy is destroyed or if the target is on another plane of existence. For the duration, you can use a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to do one of the following.

entries.name: Control
entries: You directly control the target's actions and movement on its next turn by manipulating the effigy's limbs. That target can only take the {@action Dash|XPHB}, {@action Disengage|XPHB}, {@action Hide|XPHB}, or {@action Utilize|XPHB} action. While controlled, the target's movements are jerky and unnatural.

entries.name: Harm
entries: You prod the effigy and deal {@damage 2d8} damage to the target. This damage is Bludgeoning, Piercing, Slashing or another damage type, appropriate to the means by which you harm the effigy. This damage ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB}.

entries.name: Restrain
entries: You submerge the effigy in water, causing the target to believe it is suffocating. The target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn.

spell.name: Benign Dismemberment
entries: You touch a willing creature, allowing its body parts (fingers, limbs, and even its head) to be harmlessly severed from its body for the duration. It takes no damage from such dismemberment, as long as the body part is removed swiftly and leaves a clean cut. The target's head remains alive and conscious, and parts connected to it also remain alive. All severed body parts become inanimate, but don't begin decomposition for the spell's duration. Any of the target's severed body parts that are removed during this spell's duration can be held back to the stump, which instantly restores the body part.
At the end of the duration, severed body parts become permanently severed. The target dies if vital organs have not been reattached to its head.

spell.name: Dead Fog
entries: An 10-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} of necromantic fog appears centered on a point you can see within range. The fog lasts for the duration or until strong wind (such as the one created by Gust of Wind) disperses it, ending the spell. Its area is {@variantrule Heavily Obscured|XPHB}.

Each creature in the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} makes a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 3d6} Necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. When you cast the spell, you can empower it with your own life force. You can choose to take 10, 20, or 30 Necrotic damage. This damage ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB}. When you do so, the spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every 10 Necrotic damage you take, up to a maximum of {@dice 10d6}.

As a Magic action, you can move the fog up to 30 feet. A creature also makes a save against this spell when the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} moves into its space and when it enters the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} or ends its turn there. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 3.

spell.name: Dead Mist Lash
entries: You lash out at a creature you can see within range with a glowing white tendril formed of the sinister, necromantic {@variantrule Dead|XPHB} Mists. Make a ranged spell attack roll against a creature within range. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d8} Necrotic damage.

When you deal damage with the spell, you can also drain some of your life essence to deal extra Necrotic damage to the target. You can choose to take 5, 10, or 15 Necrotic damage. This damage ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB}. When you do so, the spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for every 5 Necrotic damage you take, up to a maximum of {@dice 10d8}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Flawed Resurrection

components.m: a drop of blood, a piece of flesh, and a pinch of bone dust

entries: You touch a dead Humanoid that has been no longer than 10 days and revive it as an intelligent Undead creature. The creature returns to life with 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}. This spell closes all mortal wounds, but it doesn't restore missing body parts.

The creature's type becomes Undead and it gains {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Poison damage and the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition. It doesn't need to eat, drink, sleep, or breathe, though it must still rest for 8 hours to gain the benefits of a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

The Undead body deteriorates over time. Whenever the creature finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum permanently decreases by 1. The creature's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum can only be restored by the Greater Restoration spell. If the creature dies and is later targeted by Resurrection or similar magic, it can be returned to life with its original creature type.

spell.name: Gahoul's Glorious Gothic

m.text: a decorated gothic manor miniature worth 1,000+ GP

entries: A rift opens, pouring forth tons of brick and stonework that neatly assembles into a vast gothic estate. The estate consists of a manor surrounded by a 200-by-200-foot courtyard and a 10-foot tall wrought iron fence around the perimeter. Any creature within the estate's area is escorted away by harmless but forceful specters.

You can create any floor plan you like for the manor, but the space can't exceed 50 contiguous 10-foot Cubes or contain more than five floors. The manor is adorned with barred windows and decorative gargoyles, but is furnished and decorated as you choose. Once the manor is first created, these details are recorded in the miniature manor used to cast the spell and can't be changed. The manor contains sufficient food to feed up to 100 people for seven days. Furnishings and other objects created by this spell dissipate into smoke if taken beyond the estate's perimeter.

The manor is staffed by 50 Skeletons obedient to you, and contains enough food to serve 50 people each day for a week. The skeletons can perform any task a normal human servant could perform, but they can't attack or take any action that would directly harm another creature. Any skeleton that leaves the estate's perimeter dies. Any Humanoid buried in the manor's courtyard rises 24 hours later as a Ghoul indefinitely under your control. You can have up to 10 such ghouls at once. If given no instructions, these ghouls patrol the estate. Any Undead created by this spell dies if it leaves the estate's perimeter.

When the spell ends, the manor is magically drawn back into the rift. If you cast the spell once every seven days for 365 days in the same location, the manor becomes permanent and can't be dispelled.

spell.name: Gahoul's Scapegoat
entries: You trace a complex arcane symbol on the flesh of a willing creature you touch, marking it for sacrifice. When you are hit by an attack roll during the spell's duration and the marked creature is within 60 feet of yourself, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to teleport, swapping places with the creature and forcing it to be hit by the attack instead of you. The spell then ends.

spell.name: Gahoul's Shrieking Skull
entries: You throw a cackling skull at a point you can see within range, which emits a mortifying shriek audible out to 300 feet. Each creature in a 10-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} takes {@damage 3d4} Thunder damage, without making a saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Gahoul's Spectral Scythe
entries: You conjure a whirling phantasmal scythe in your open hand and throw it through the air. The scythe travels in a 60-foot-long, 10-foot-wide {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line}, coming to rest hovering in the air at the end of its line or before it strikes a solid surface. Each creature within the area while the scythe is moving makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 6d8} Necrotic damage on failed save or half as much damage on a successful save. A creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on this saving throw if the scythe comes to rest in the creature's space.

If you are within 120 feet of the scythe at the start of your next turn, it returns to you in a 10-foot-wide {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line}, forcing creatures within its area of travel to make the save against it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot level above 6.

spell.name: Grasp of the Grave
entries: Spectral skeletal arms emerge from the ground in a 15-foot-radius circle on the ground that you can see within range. The area becomes {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} for the duration.

Each creature you choose in the area makes a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 3d6} Force damage and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. Whenever a creature you can see enters the area or ends its turn there, you can force it to make a save against the spell. A creature makes that save only once per turn.
When a creature tries to leave the area, you can force it to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0 until the start of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 4.

spell.name: Inexorable Sarcophagus
entries: You toss a palm-sized sarcophagus at a Large or small creature you can see within range, which must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw as the sarcophagus grows to full size and attempts to trap it within. On a failed save, the target has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} and {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} conditions, its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0, and it has {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover} from attacks and effects outside of the sarcophagus for the duration.

The sarcophagus is an object of the same size as the target creature with AC 15 and 100 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. It has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Poison and Psychic damage. If it is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, the spell ends.
A target within the sarcophagus makes another Dexterity saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

If it successfully saves against this spell three times, it escapes the sarcophagus and the spell ends. If it fails its saves three times, the sarcophagus crushes it and deals 100 Bludgeoning damage to it. The successes and failures needn't be consecutive; keep track of both until the target collects three of a kind.
A creature killed by this spell rises at the start of your next turn as a Mummy that follows your verbal orders.

spell.name: Might of the Abyss

components.m: a small, black strip of ribbon

entries: You channel power from the Lower Planes, enhancing three creatures other than yourself within range. Whenever it deals damage with a weapon, it deals an extra {@damage 1d4} Necrotic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Rusting Grasp
entries: You conjure a potent acid at your fingertips, which can corrode metal and burn flesh. Make a melee spell attack against a creature or object within your reach. On a hit, a creature takes {@damage 6d4} Acid damage and it has a -3 penalty to its AC, to a minimum of 10, for 1 hour.

If you target a nonmagical metal object with this spell that isn't being worn or carried, you corrode and destroy parts of the object you choose that can fit within a 1-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 2d4} for each spell slot level above 3. If you target a nonmagical object, you can destroy an additional cubic foot for each slot level above 3.

spell.name: Spark of Life
entries: With a quick jolt of necromantic energy, a corpse momentarily rises to obey you. Choose the corpse of a Huge or smaller creature that has died within the last hour. When you cast this spell, the corpse stands up and can move up to 15 feet and make a single melee attack using your spell attack modifier against a target of your choice within its reach. On a hit, this attack deals Bludgeoning damage based on the corpse's size: Tiny ({@dice 1d4}), Small ({@dice 1d6}), Medium ({@dice 1d8}), Large ({@dice 1d10}), and Huge ({@dice 1d12}). Once the corpse attacks, it once again crumples into a heap. A corpse targeted by this spell doesn't become an Undead creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by one damage die when you reach levels 5 (2 dice), 11 (3 dice), and 17 (4 dice).

spell.name: Sulfuric Smoke
entries: You create a 5-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} of acidic smoke at a point you can see within range. Each creature in the {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} Acid damage. The area of the {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} is {@variantrule Lightly Obscured|XPHB} with noxious fumes and lasts until the start of your next turn. A creature entirely within the {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d8}), 11 ({@dice 3d8}), and 17 ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Arc Blade

m.text: a Melee weapon with which you have proficiency and that is worth 1+ CP

entries: As lightning surges through the weapon used in the spell's casting, you make one attack. This attack can be a melee attack or ranged spell attack using the weapon with a range of 15 feet, as a wave of energy extends from the weapon. The attack uses your spellcasting ability for the attack and damage rolls instead of using Strength or Dexterity. If it is a ranged attack, it deals Lightning damage. Otherwise, it can deal Lightning damage or the weapon's normal damage type (your choice).

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: Whether you deal Lightning damage or the weapon's normal damage type, the attack deals extra Lightning damage when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 1d6}), 11 ({@dice 2d6}), and 17 ({@dice 3d6}).

spell.name: Burning Blade

m.text: a Melee weapon with which you have proficiency and that is worth 1+ CP

entries: Engulfing the weapon used in the spell's casting in flames, you make one attack. This attack and any other attacks you make using the weapon until the start of your next turn use your spellcasting ability for the attack and damage rolls instead of using Strength or Dexterity. If such an attack deals damage, it can be Fire damage or the weapon's normal damage type (your choice).

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: Whether you deal Fire damage or the weapon's normal damage type, attacks you make using this weapon until the start of your next turn deal extra Fire damage when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 1d6}), 11 ({@dice 2d6}), and 17 ({@dice 3d6}).

spell.name: Card Trick
entries: With a flash of your hands, you fling a playing or tarot card charged with magical energy. Choose whether you make a ranged spell attack roll or if the target makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a hit or a failed saving throw, the target takes {@damage 1d8} Force damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d8}), 11 ({@dice 3d8}), and 17 ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Cheat
entries: You twist your fingers and fate seems to follow suit. Until the end of your next turn, you can reroll any ability check you make to play nonmagical games of skill. Therefore, this spell could influence a game of poker, but not the result of a {@item Deck of Many Things|XDMG}.

spell.name: Cryptogram
entries: You send a small scroll with a message to a creature of your choice. The recipient must be a creature known to you and also be on the same plane of existence as you. The scroll hovers in front of the recipient, drops into its pocket, or lands atop something nearby. The scroll's message can be up to 8 characters long (spaces count as characters). Once you send a scroll, you can't send another scroll to that recipient for 24 hours.

spell.name: Force Buckler
entries: You summon a translucent field of force, which springs forth from the gauntlet used in the spell's casting. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +2 bonus to your {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} while you aren't wielding a Shield. This spell ends early if you are hit by an attack.

spell.name: Force Dart
entries: You fling a dart of magical force at a creature within range. Make a Ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} Force damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d10}), 11 ({@dice 3d10}), and 17 ({@dice 4d10}).

spell.name: Force Weapon
entries: You conjure a blade of magical force in the air, which strikes at a creature within range. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} Force damage. The blade remains in existence for a short time; until the start of your next turn, you can make a single strike with your mystical blade as an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: You make an additional attack when you reach levels 5 (2 attacks), 11 (3 attacks), and 17 (4 attacks). These attacks can target the same creature or different ones.

spell.name: Frigid Blade

m.text: a Melee weapon with which you have proficiency and that is worth 1+ CP

entries: Encasing the weapon used in the spell's casting in ice, you make one attack. The attack uses your spellcasting ability for the attack and damage rolls instead of using Strength or Dexterity. The weapon's damage die increases by 1 step ({@dice d4} → {@dice d6} → {@dice d8} → {@dice d10} → {@dice d12} or {@dice 2d6}, your choice). The weapon's damage dice don't increase if it has more than one weapon damage die. If the attack deals damage, it can be Cold damage or the weapon's normal damage type (your choice).

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: Whether you deal Cold damage or the weapon's normal damage type, the attack deals extra Cold damage when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 1d6}), 11 ({@dice 2d6}), and 17 ({@dice 3d6}).

spell.name: Lightning Surge
entries: A dazzling array of lightning bolts erupts from you. Each creature within a 5-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} Lightning damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d6}), 11 ({@dice 3d6}), and 17 ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Magic Daggers
entries: With a flourish, you conjure two daggers composed of magical force and flick them at targets within range. You can throw the daggers at one target or multiple within range. Make a separate ranged spell attack roll for each dagger, dealing {@damage 1d6} Force damage on a hit. The daggers vanish after the attack.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: This spell creates an additional dagger and you make an additional attack when you reach level 5 (3 attacks), 11 (4 attacks), and 17 (5 attacks).

spell.name: Moment to Think
entries: When you cast this spell, you briefly stop time for everyone but yourself. You can take one additional action and move around in your space while no time passes for other creatures. That action can be used only to take the {@action Search|XPHB}, {@action Study|XPHB}, or {@action Utilize|XPHB} action. Furthermore, you can't affect or damage any creature or object, other than objects you are wearing or carrying. If an object leaves your hand, it also becomes frozen in time.

spell.name: Phantom Grapnel
entries: You conjure a chain and hook made of magical force, which you propel at a creature or unoccupied space you can see within range. When you target a space or a creature of Huge size or larger, your grapnel pulls you to that target in a straight line. You provoke Opportunity Attacks for this movement as normal. When you target a creature of Large size or smaller, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 10 feet toward you.

spell.name: Quickstep
entries: This spell imparts a flash of speed. Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

spell.name: Sonic Pulse
entries: You compress a thunderous boom into an {@condition invisible} ball and project it at a creature you can see within range. The target makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 1d8} Thunder damage and has the {@condition Deafened|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn.
If the spell's target is within 10 feet of you, the spell is amplified and its damage becomes {@dice 1d10}, instead of {@dice 1d8}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} (or {@dice 1d10}, if amplified) when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d8} or {@dice 2d10}), 11 ({@dice 3d8} or {@dice 3d10}), and 17 ({@dice 4d8} or {@dice 4d10}).

spell.name: Springheel
entries: You flood magic into your legs, allowing you to bound high into the air. Until the start of your next turn, the distance of your Long and High Jumps increases by 10 feet (this extra distance costs movement as normal), and you suffer no penalty from making a standing jump.

spell.name: Sulfuric Smoke
entries: You create a 5-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} of acidic smoke at a point you can see within range. Each creature in the {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} Acid damage. The area of the {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} is {@variantrule Lightly Obscured|XPHB} with noxious fumes and lasts until the start of your next turn. A creature entirely within the {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d8}), 11 ({@dice 3d8}), and 17 ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Thunderous Echo
entries: You produce a wave of noise in a 10-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}, which can be heard up to 100 feet away. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} Thunder damage.

An echo of this noise persists for the spell's duration. If you cast this spell again before the end of your next turn, the spell is amplified and its damage becomes {@dice 1d8}, instead of {@dice 1d6}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} (or {@dice 1d8}, if amplified) when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d6} or {@dice 2d8}), 11 ({@dice 3d6} or {@dice 3d8}), and 17 ({@dice 4d6} or {@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: After Image

m.text: a silver hand mirror worth 50+ GP

entries: You create an illusory duplicate of yourself which follows your every movement. When a creature hits you with an attack roll while your duplicate remains, roll a {@dice d6}. If it rolls a 3 or higher, the duplicate is hit instead of you and the duplicate is destroyed. The duplicate otherwise ignores all other damage and effects. The duplicate reappears if you move 15 feet or more on your turn or take the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action.
A creature is unaffected by this spell if it has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition, {@sense Blindsight|XPHB}, or {@sense Truesight|XPHB}.

spell.name: Blood Print

components.m: an ounce or more of blood

entries: At your touch, wet blood on a surface shifts and reforms into a pattern of crimson blotches. This blood print is unique to the particular creature to whom the blood belongs, but you can determine the creature's kind (such as Human, Gnoll, Deer, or Fire Giant) by examining the general shape. A print can be preserved by pressing a sheet of paper against it. If this spell is cast twice, it is possible to match blood samples originating from the same creature.

spell.name: Clue
entries: When you cast this spell, all footprints and fingerprints within a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you become highlighted and glow faintly for the duration. When you cast the spell, choose any point in time up to 10 days ago. Only footprints and fingerprints left between that time and the present will be highlighted. Each creature that leaves footprints and fingerprints is assigned a unique color, but are not otherwise identified. Any creature that moves or touches objects within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} will also leave colorful footprints and fingerprints, which might reveal {@condition invisible} creatures in the area.

spell.name: Consecrated Armor
entries: You trace a holy symbol on yourself, creating an {@condition invisible} barrier until the spell ends. Your base AC becomes 12 plus your Dexterity modifier. If you are attacked by an Aberration, Fey, Fiend, or Undead, you add your spellcasting ability modifier to your AC against that attack. The spell ends early if the target dons armor.

spell.name: Dire Warning
entries: You receive a message of up to 6 words from yourself in the future, warning you of a critical threat or pointing you toward a fruitful avenue. At some point in the future, once you have learned why you sent the message, you must perform a ritual over the course of 10 minutes, which can be done during a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, to deliver the message back in time to your past self.

Once you cast this spell, you can't cast it again for 7 days or until you perform this ritual. If you cast this spell and receive no message, it indicates that you will never complete the ritual in the future, possibly owing to your death or another hindrance.

spell.name: Game of Fate
entries: You magically compel a creature within range that can hear and understand you to a nonmagical game with vital consequences. An unwilling creature can make a Wisdom saving throw to resist this effect. On a failed save, the creature is compelled to join you in the game.

The loser of the game takes {@damage 6d6} Psychic damage. If no player loses or has won by the end of the spell's duration, both you and the target take this damage. If you or one of your allies harms the target, you forfeit the game, and vice versa if the target or one of its allies harms you. Additionally, you and the target creature can negotiate for greater stakes. You can wager for higher Psychic damage (up to a maximum of {@dice 12d6}), property, or more esoteric rewards, such as bestowal of a noble title. The spell reveals if a creature attempts to bet property it doesn't own. A bet is finalized when you and the target agree on the bet, solidifying the bet with a handshake or similar gesture. Property or currency bet on the game is teleported to the winner at the game's conclusion. The loser is also magically compelled to take any action (such as bestowing a noble title) wagered as part of a bet.
Lastly, no spell, magical effect, or creature other than you and the target can influence the game's outcome.

spell.name: Invisibility Purge
entries: A 120-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you disrupts invisibility. Each creature within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} is outlined with a magical aura and can't benefit from the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition. {@condition Invisible|XPHB} objects within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} are rendered visible.

spell.name: Jethro's Instant Reload
entries: One Ranged weapon you touch becomes enchanted to reload itself automatically. If the weapon has the Cooldown, Loading, or Reload property, you ignore the property for the duration. When the weapon's ammunition is depleted, ammunition you are carrying teleports into the weapon.

spell.name: Memorize

m.text: a page of written text and a length of silver string worth 10+ GP, tied in a knot, which the spell consumes

entries: While casting this spell, your eyes pass over the words on a page, which are committed to your memory. For the next year, you remember the exact details of all information on the page. After that time, you have advantage on all Intelligence checks you make to recall this information.

spell.name: Nondescript
entries: This spell makes you seem unremarkable to others, though it doesn't change your actual appearance. For the duration, a creature that sees or hears you is unable to recall specific details about you, though it can remember actions you took or events that transpired around you.

spell.name: Rumor
entries: You magically spread a rumor of 10 words or less in a 100-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} centered on you. Any creature within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} that is near three or more other creatures that share a common language believes that they hear the rumor being repeated by someone nearby. Different creatures hear the rumor from different people, so a concrete origin point is impossible to discern. Generally, creatures won't become {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} upon hearing even the most vicious rumors, but hearing a rumor can affect their attitude positively or negatively.

spell.name: Scrutinize Foe
entries: You discern minute details concerning one creature you can see within range. You learn two of the following pieces of information of your choice about the target: its {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB}, Speeds, Immunities (if any), Resistances (if any), highest ability score, lowest ability score, and enchantments (which reveals which spells, if any, are currently affecting the target). The GM must share with you the chosen information.

spell.name: Transient Bulwark

m.text: a pearl worth 10+ GP, which the spell consumes

entries: A fragile, {@condition invisible} shield protects you for the duration. The next attack roll against you has a -10 penalty to hit, and the spell ends.

spell.name: Zero Gravity
entries: This spell creates a zero gravity environment within a 30-foot radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere}, centered on a point you can see within range.

In a zero gravity environment, creatures and objects hang in the air until they are moved. A creature in zero gravity can move only by pushing or pulling against a fixed object or surface within reach (such as a wall or a ceiling), which allows it to move as if it were climbing. Its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is otherwise 0. Once a creature or object is set into motion, it can't stop moving until it collides with an obstacle. A creature automatically continues its movement at the same speed at the start of each of its turns, and an object set in motion moves with the same speed each round after it was moved.
Creatures and objects in an area of zero gravity have no weight, but still may require significant force to move. When the spell ends, affected objects and creatures fall downward.

spell.name: Divine Wrath
entries: You deliver a mote of divine wrath to a point you can see within range. Each creature you choose in a 10-foot- radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on that point must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d10} Necrotic or Radiant damage (your choice), or half as much damage on a successful save. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, the creature is disintegrated into salt and everything it was wearing or carrying falls in its space. The target can be revived only by a True Resurrection or a Wish spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each spell slot level above 3.

spell.name: Halo of Flame
entries: A ring of flame ignites above your head and emits heat in a 5-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you. Whenever the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} enters the space of a creature you can see and whenever a creature you can see enters the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} or ends its turn there, you can force that creature to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d8} Fire damage, or half as much damage on a successful save. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot level above 2.

spell.name: Perforating Shot

time.condition: which you take immediately after hitting or missing with a ranged attack using a weapon

entries: As your attack hits or misses the target, the weapon or ammunition transforms into a 5-foot-wide {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} of magical energy that extends out to the weapon's normal range. The {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} includes the attack's original target.

Each creature within the {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking Force damage equal to the weapon's normal damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The weapon's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1.

spell.name: Sanction
entries: You fling a drop of blood at a creature you can see within range, which must succeed a Constitution saving throw or be marked for the duration. Whenever you take damage, the marked target takes {@damage 1d8} Necrotic or Radiant damage (your choice). The spell ends early if you end your turn more than 30 feet away from the target.

spell.name: Stone Bones
entries: Choose a creature you can see within range. The target has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage until the spell ends at the end of your next turn.

spell.name: Swift Flight
entries: Streaks of energy flow from the back of a creature you touch, tracing the shapes of wings. The target has a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 60 feet and can hover until the end of its next turn. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is in the air and nothing is holding it aloft.

spell.name: Word of Control
entries: You recite a word of authority to a creature you can see within range, which must make a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn. A creature targeted by this spell within the last 24 hours automatically succeeds on its saving throw against it.

While {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, the target doesn't move or act unless verbally commanded by you to do so. You can issue commands to the target (no action required), such as "Attack that creature," "Move over there," or "Fetch that object." The target does its best to obey on its turn.

spell.name: Word of Force
entries: You recite a word of magical force to a creature you can see within range, which makes a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 1d6} Force damage, is pushed 10 feet away from you, and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage only.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Word of Terror
entries: You recite a word of fear to a creature you can see within range, which makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 2d6} Psychic damage and has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage only.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 2.

spell.name: Word of Transience
entries: You recite a word of banishment to a creature you can see within range, which must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature vanishes from its current plane of existence and appears on the Ethereal Plane (the spell ends instantly if it is already on that plane).

You can give the target the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition while it is on the Ethereal Plane. While on the Ethereal Plane, the target can perceive the plane it left, which is cast in shades of gray. It can affect and be affected only by other creatures on the Ethereal Plane, and creatures on the other plane can't perceive it unless they have a special ability that lets them perceive things on the Ethereal Plane.
The target returns to the plane it left at the start of your next turn, appearing in the nearest unoccupied space to the location it left.
